name: magnitude
readme_summary: Magnitude is an open-source, vision-first browser agent that uses AI to understand and interact with web interfaces. It enables users to control browsers with natural language for tasks like navigation, interaction, data extraction, and testing.
primary_use_case: Automating web tasks, integrating applications without APIs, extracting data, and testing web applications using natural language commands and visual understanding.
cover_image_prompt: A highly intelligent, anthropomorphic robot with large, expressive eyes (representing vision AI) is sitting at a futuristic control panel. Instead of buttons, the panel has a large, interactive screen displaying a complex website. The robot is using a holographic stylus to precisely point at elements on the screen, manipulating them as if they were physical objects. Streams of structured data, visualized as glowing geometric shapes, flow from the website on the screen into a 'knowledge vault' beside the robot. Subtle code snippets and UI elements are projected in the background, hinting at the automation and testing capabilities. The overall mood is one of effortless control and intelligent understanding. The style is a clean, 3D isometric illustration with a vibrant, tech-inspired color palette.

name: rustnet
description: A cross-platform network monitoring terminal UI tool built with Rust.
readme_summary: RustNet is a cross-platform terminal UI tool for real-time network monitoring. It provides detailed insights into network connections, interface statistics, and packet data, with advanced filtering and process identification capabilities.
key_features: Real-time Network Monitoring (TCP, UDP, ICMP, ARP)
Detailed Connection States (TCP, QUIC, DNS, SSH, UDP)
Deep Packet Inspection (DPI) for application protocols
Smart Connection Lifecycle with visual indicators
Service Name Resolution and Reverse DNS Lookups
primary_use_case: Real-time network monitoring and analysis directly from the terminal.
cover_image_prompt: A vigilant network cartographer standing at a bustling crossroads, meticulously charting the flow of digital information. They hold a magnifying glass, revealing intricate details within glowing streams of data representing network packets. Different colored streams signify various protocols (TCP, UDP, QUIC), with some streams showing signs of congestion or errors, visualized as flickering or distorted lines. Small, transparent screens hover nearby, displaying connection states, process IDs, and protocol names. The cartographer's map is a dynamic terminal interface, with columns of real-time statistics. The scene is set in a dimly lit, high-tech control room, with subtle glowing UI elements and digital particles. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration with a clean, modern aesthetic and a vibrant, data-rich color palette.

name: VidBee
description: Download videos from almost any website worldwide
readme_summary: VidBee is an open-source video downloader built with Electron and yt-dlp, supporting over 1000 websites. It offers a user-friendly interface for downloading videos and audio, with features like RSS auto-download and a browser script for quick URL integration.
key_features: Download videos and audios from 1000+ websites
Built with Electron and powered by yt-dlp
Browser script for quick download integration
primary_use_case: Downloading videos and audio content from a wide variety of online platforms.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly, stylized robot with a large, open toolbox overflowing with digital video reels and audio waveforms. The robot is holding a universal remote control, pointing it at a holographic projection of the internet, from which streams of video data are being neatly collected into the toolbox. Subtle UI elements resembling download progress bars and a list of website logos (YouTube, TikTok, Twitter, etc.) are visible on the robot's screen. The background is a clean, modern digital space with soft, glowing lines. The overall mood is helpful and efficient. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and clear, friendly character design, embodying the VidBee name.

name: AndroidMic
description: Use your Android phone as a microphone for your PC
readme_summary: AndroidMic is a multiplatform application that allows users to use their Android phone as a wireless or USB microphone for their PC. It supports various connection methods and includes features like noise cancellation and audio visualization.
primary_use_case: Transforming an Android phone into a PC microphone for enhanced audio input.
cover_image_prompt: A whimsical scene depicting an Android phone with a large, glowing microphone icon emanating from its speaker. This phone is connected by a shimmering digital cord (representing Wi-Fi or USB) to a stylized PC, which has a large, welcoming speaker grille. Sound waves, visualized as colorful, flowing ribbons, travel from the phone's microphone icon towards the PC's speaker. In the background, subtle UI elements like sliders and waveform displays float in the air, hinting at advanced audio options and visualization. The overall mood is one of seamless connection and amplified sound, with a clean, modern illustration style.

name: sokuji
description: Live speech translation application built with Electron 34 and React, using OpenAI's Realtime API.
readme_summary: Sokuji is a cross-platform desktop application and browser extension that provides real-time speech translation using various AI APIs like OpenAI and Google Gemini. It aims to break down language barriers in live conversations and online meetings.
key_features: Browser extension for Chrome, Edge, and Chromium-based browsers
Integration with Google Meet and Microsoft Teams
Supports OpenAI, Google Gemini, Palabra.ai, and Kizuna AI APIs
primary_use_case: To provide real-time speech translation for live conversations and online meetings, breaking down language barriers.
cover_image_prompt: A wise old owl wearing a headset, perched on a globe. The owl is speaking into a microphone, and from its beak, streams of colorful, glowing sound waves are transforming into different languages represented by distinct symbols and scripts. One stream is being caught by a small, stylized ear icon representing the listener, while another stream is being projected onto a floating screen displaying translated text. Subtle digital particles and faint code snippets float around the scene, hinting at the underlying technology. The background is a soft, gradient sky, focusing all attention on the owl and its translation magic. The style should be a whimsical 3D isometric illustration with vibrant colors and clear, friendly iconography.
